subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|牛%馬|うし%うま}}: a [[small]] [[breed]] of [[horse]], [[extinct]] since 1947
* {{ja-r|海%馬|うみ%うま}}: [[seahorse]]
* {{ja-r|牛%馬|ぎゅう%ば}}: [[ox]]en and [[horse]]s, [[beast of burden]]
* {{ja-r|海%馬|かい%ば}}: [[seahorse]]; [[walrus]]; [[hippocampus]]
* {{ja-r|河%馬|か%ば}}: [[hippopotamus]], a [[hippo]]
* {{ja-r|縞%馬|しま%うま}}, {{ja-r|斑%馬|しま%うま}}: [[zebra]]
* {{ja-r|騸%馬|せん%ば}}: [[gelding]]
* {{ja-r|馬酔木|あせび}}, {{ja-r|馬%酔%木|ば%すい%ぼく}}: [[Japanese andromeda]]
* {{ja-r|馬%面|うま%づら}}: a [[horseface]], a very [[long]] [[face]]; [[horse-faced]], very [[long-faced]]
* {{ja-r|馬%鹿|ば%か}}: a [[fool]], an [[idiot]]; [[foolish]], [[idiotic]], [[stupid]]
* {{ja-r|馬%鹿%力|ば%かぢ%から}}: [[incredible]] [[strength]]; [[incredibly]] [[strong]]
* {{ja-r|馬%脚|ば%きゃく}}
* {{ja-r|馬%具|ば%ぐ}}: horse [[harness]], horse [[tack]]
* {{ja-r|馬%券|ば%けん}}
* {{ja-r|馬%耳 東%風|ば%じ とう%ふう}}
* {{ja-r|馬%車|ば%しゃ}}: [[horse-drawn]] [[carriage]], [[wagon]] or [[cart]]
* {{ja-r|馬%糧|ば%りょう}}: horse [[feed]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|馬%車%馬|ば%しゃう%ま}}
* {{ja-r|馬%術|ば%じゅつ}}: [[equestrianism]], [[equestrian]] [[skill]]s, [[horsemanship]]
* {{ja-r|馬%上|ば%じょう}}: on [[horseback]]
* {{ja-r|馬%尾|ば%び}}: [[cauda equina]]
* {{ja-r|馬%力|ば%りき}}: [[horsepower]]
* {{ja-r|馬%鈴薯|ば%れいしょ}}: a [[potato]] (''[[Solanum]] [[tuberosum]]'')
* {{ja-r|馬%簾|ば%れん}}
* {{ja-r|子%馬|こ%うま}}: a [[baby]] [[horse]], a [[foal]]
* {{ja-r|馬%子|ま%ご}}: [[packhorse]] [[driver]]
* {{ja-r|馬%手|ば%しゅ}}, {{ja-r|馬%手|め%て}}
* {{ja-r|木%馬|もく%ば}}: a [[wooden]] [[horse]]
* {{ja-r|馬陸|やすで}}: [[millipede]]
* {{ja-r|騾%馬|ら%ば}}: [[mule]]
* {{ja-r|驢%馬|ろ%ば}}: [[donkey]]
* {{ja-r|競%馬|けい%ば}}: a [[horse race]]
* {{ja-r|弓%馬|きゅう%ば}}: [[archery]] and [[horsemanship]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Horse}} [[File:Nokota Horses cropped.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|馬}} (''uma'', ''muma''): a pair of '''[[horse]]s'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|うま|yomi=k}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=うま}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} Recorded in the [[w:Nihon Shoki|Nihon Shoki]] as having been brought over from the Korean peninsula kingdom of [[w:Baekje|Baekje]], with the earlier reading of ''ma''. The initial ''m'' sound was apparently emphasized,{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}} possibly similar to ''*mma'', becoming then ''uma'' or ''muma'', via processes also seen in the word {{m|ja|梅|tr=ume, mume||plum}}. The ''ma'' sound denoting "horse" is common to a number of languages of central Asia, where horses were first domesticated, suggesting a possible cognate root. Compare {{cog|mnc|ᠮᠣᡵᡳᠨ|tr=morin||horse}}, {{cog|mn|морь||horse}}, {{cog|ko|말||horse}}, {{cog|cmn|馬|tr=mǎ||horse}}, and {{cog|ine-pro|*márkos||horse}} and descendants such as {{cog|ga|marc||horse|pos=archaic}} or {{cog|en|mare||female horse}}. More at {{m|ine-pro|*márkos}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|うま|count=匹}}

# a [[horse]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=うま|shogi}} a promoted [[bishop]]
# a [[sawhorse]]: a four-leg [[stand]] made of wood or iron for supporting other materials

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|むま|yomi=k}}
Shift from ''uma'' form, becoming more common starting from the [[w:Heian period|Heian Period]]. This change later reverted, and ''muma'' is now considered obsolete.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|むま}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=むま|obsolete}} a [[horse]]
#* {{RQ:Man'yōshū|20|4372}}
#*: 阿志加良能 美佐可多麻波理 可閇理美須 阿例波久江由久 阿良志乎母 多志夜波婆可流 不破乃世伎 久江弖和波由久 '''牟麻'''能都米 都久志能佐伎尓 知麻利為弖 阿例波伊波々牟 母呂々々波 佐祁久等麻乎須 可閇利久麻弖尓
#* c. '''935''' [[w:Tosa Nikki|Tosa Nikki]]
#*: ふぢはらのときざね、ふなぢなれど、'''むま'''のはなむけす。
#* c. '''935''' [[w:Tosa Nikki|Tosa Nikki]]
#*: けふはあを'''むま'''をおもへど、かひなし。
